docs.lead_paragraph: Public health agencies and drug treatment centers nationwide are scrambling to battle an explosive increase in cases of hepatitis C, a scourge they believe stems at least in part from a surge in intravenous heroin use.

headline.main: Hepatitis Increasingly Goes Hand in Hand With Heroin Abuse
headline.print_headline: Hepatitis Increasingly Goes Hand in Hand With Heroin Abuse

docs.snippet: Public health agencies and drug treatment centers nationwide are scrambling to battle an explosive increase in cases of hepatitis C, a scourge they believe stems at least in part from a surge in intravenous heroin use.

docs.lead_paragraph: The head of soccer's governing body for North and Central America and the Caribbean, Enrique Sanz, has been fired following the FBI investigation into alleged corruption in FIFA, his lawyer said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: North American Soccer Body's General Secretary Sanz Fired

headline.main: It’s Time to Compensate Kidney Donors

docs.abstract: A debate is starting in America and other Western countries about whether, and in what form, kidney donors should be compensated.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 10 Republican presidential hopefuls who took to the stage for their first debate in Cleveland faced a daunting task in distinguishing themselves among a sprawling field of candidates. Along the way, they puffed up their own records in office and public life and veered occasionally from the truth.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the Federal Reserve puzzles over what is holding back U.S. wages and productivity six years into the economic recovery, a pasta sauce company in New Jersey may offer some answers.

docs.lead_paragraph: CVS Health will exclude 31 more prescription medicines from insurance coverage next year, including Viagra and treatments for diabetes and multiple sclerosis.

headline.main: 31 Drugs, Including Viagra, Will Be Cut From CVS’s Formulary
headline.print_headline: 31 Drugs, Including Viagra, Will Be Cut From CVS’s Formulary

docs.abstract: CVS Health unveils plans to exclude additional 31 prescription medicines, including Viagra, from insurance coverage in 2016.
